Reviews.Title: “Hotel canton, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: hussein t
Reviews.Content: Very cool small clean and central hotel in Barcelona, walking distance from Ramblas and all.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book too many hotel nights with Venere.com”
Reviews.Author: gypsysing
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at this hotel through Venere.com. Thewebsite made us pay for a triple room where as there was a double room available and made it look like it was the last room for 4 nights. The hotel location is great and front desk people are nice but we got conned into paying 20 euros per night extra because of the website. Just book one night and when you get here deal directly with the hotel. there are so many hotels in the old Barri Gotic. no need to panic. that is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JoD2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very reasonable but after reading some of the reviews I wasnt sure what I would make of it! The location was perfect- 7 girls away for weekend looking to see the sights, shop and go out and the location is spot on, could walk metro it everywhere although this ment that there was a bit of noise at night. Staff were friendly (well most of them if perhaps a little grumpy at times) and they always answered any questions we had! Rooms were clean and not too small with fridge, balcony safe. Shower/bath was nice and powerful and plenty of hot water. Only thing I would say is the air con didnt work so not sure how good that would be in summer but for this time of year is perfect- the balcony gave a nice breeze as we were on third floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AdamxG
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable price, very clean room and comfortable (firm mattress) beds, plenty of hot water and adequate heating. Handy to have a fridge and a safe in the room. Friendly and courteous staff, all English-speaking, and tolerant of my attempts at speaking Spanish! Above all, this has to be an almost perfect location for a stay in Barcelona: just off La Rambla, and only 2 minutes from the quayside, right in the old city. Perfect for exploring on foot. We stayed for a five day break just before Christmas and it was pretty quiet - I'd expect it to be somewhat noisier in high season. We could hear street life going on late into the night. We would stay here again, what more could I say?

Reviews.Title: “Ideal budget hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Dec105
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a no-frills, cheap and cheerful budget hotel in downtown Barcelona, look no further than the Hotel Canton. Finding it is the first part. Located in one of the narrow streets within the maze that is Barrio Gotico, a bit of advance research on Google Streetview or other maps would be advisable. But once you've got your bearings, you're within walking distance of the Ramblas and all the cafes, bars and restaurants that populate this area. Metro is also a short walk away. Staff are friendly and helpful. Room quality was surprisingly good - though the single bed was on the small side, which might not suit a taller or larger person. Digital wall safe and flat screen TV are included, and the bathroom / shower is clean and modern. The size of the room itself is not designed for swinging of cats, but then again, I tend not to bring my cat away for weekends - much less swing her about a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value In Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Leixlip_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room for two nights in early October at a cost of €40 per night. The room was small but adequate with a flat screen TV, a free safe and a nice bathroom with a shower and a hair dryer. The bed was a little bit hard but ok. The hotel is in a central location with La Rambla, the Port and beach all close by. The many bars and restaurants of Carre Ample are a couple of minutes away. The staff were friendly, the hotel was clean and offers excellant value for money. Although it is a one star hotel I believe it deserves to be at least a superior two star. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Slickvic1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in a double room. A couple of minutes walk from the Metro at Drassanes (right on Las Ramblas), also walking distance for many restaurants in the Gothic quarter and slightly further to Port Vell (10 minutes walk to the restaurants here). Checking in was simple and the staff speak English but definitely appreciated a 'thank you', 'good morning' and 'good bye' in Catalan. Rooms were quite small but it's only a place to sleep and shower so this wasn't an issue for me. Safe and decent hairdryer in the room which was serviced daily. Didn't choose to get breakfast at the hotel so I don't know what it would have been like. I am a very light sleeper so I took my earplugs with me but it wasn't noisy and there are signs in various places asking for silence after 11pm which was adhered to on the most part. Highly recommended hotel for it's location, cleanliness and good value but don't expect a fancy room - you get what you pay for in that respect! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: Verunchic
Reviews.Content: I was searching for the hotel in BCN for a 4 nights over 1 month before, looked through almost all of them and found that its a very expensive city, so I thought that I'll not find a hotel for over 80 euros, U thought that I could find a hostel more cheaper than hotels, but was not so, the price for the single room with not shared bathroom was as at good *** hotel. And then I found this cute place! Yay! This hotel is a real catch! The first its price!!! it very good for value! The room has private bathroom with hairdryer, TV, phone, security box, air condition, heating and fridge.. Lugagge care service for free.Reception open 24h. I had a single room, it was not so spacy but quite normal for 1 person, they have double rooms and they're more spacy and had a small terrace. At first I communicated with the hotel to know about the length of the beds cause someone wrote that they have too short beds and its not a good news for tall people)), but they answered me that bed size is 190cm x 90cm, and its ok! They also suggested me that they have small double rooms with double bed, bed has this size 120x190cm. The rate was 20 euro higher than mine so I decided to take single. These double rooms has a balcony to the back side of the house, there is no special view, but you have natural light and sun, and it's quieter. My room was exterior to the street with window and the view was the house, but it was ok. If the rooms will have view to the street Nou de Sant Francesc there is a construction works right opposite the building so its more noisy cause they begin to work over 9am and the cran begin to work))). You can take the breakfast in the hotel for 5 euros but I didnt, I had a breakfast neat the hotel at the Vitaminas with fresh juices, it was over 8.5-9. Its very close to La Rambla and near metro station Drassannes, 2 stations from Placa Catalunia, close to Gothic quarter and Port, you can take rickshaws to go to the beach or to some cute restaurants in the Port. So this hotel is great for its price and clean rooms!!! I'll recommend and have already recommended it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ChaplainTappman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my first trip to Barcelona and was not at all disappointed. It is an excellent hotel for the price; clean, great location, and remarkably quiet. The staff was friendly if not overly helpful (though I never really asked for help). I didn't try the €5 breakfast, so I can't comment on the food, but it appeared to be an "all-you-can-eat" continental deal, which is not a bad price for the area (assuming the food is decent). There is free wifi, but it is only available in the lobby and ground floor (not in guest rooms), but there are TVs, phones, and fridges in the room. The neighborhood is rather touristy, but that's not necessarily a bad thing, and it's an excellent launching point for the rest of the city. Would recommend in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great price,great location!!”
Reviews.Author: billydave
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after reading mixed reviews,and glad we did! Fantastic location(2 minute walk to Las Ramblas,5 minutes to the port area),good price,friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are basic but clean,beds and pillows may be a bit hard but its a room for a night,no more than that! WARNING...mind your pockets from the [...] in Las Ramblas,pickpockets and 3 of our party lost some euros!!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL VERY CENTRAL IDEAL FOR PRE-CRUISE STAY”
Reviews.Author: elizabethkillin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for only one night as we were departing for our cruise the following day. We could't have chosen a better budget hotel . The location was ideal for a short stay in the heart of things. The hotel is situated at the bottom of Las Ramblas in a side street and across the road from the Port., The hotel room was basic, but clean and we had no complaints for 70E. it was a good price. We travelled on a Ryanair flight to Gerona Airport and caught the Barcelona bus to Nord Bus Station, we then got a taxi to the hotel which cost under 20E. We opted to have breakfast in the hotel which cost 5E each it was very basic, a cold buffet it was ok. The hotel staff were pleasant and offered a taxi when we were leaving, but we only had to walk a few minutes to the cruise bus at Christopher Columbus Monument. All in all a pleasant stay in Barcelona, if I was visiting again for a short stay I would certainly use this hotel again due to the close proximity to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sighip
Reviews.Content: In essence, it's a good location in a bustling part of Barcelona. The price you pay is value for money. The reception staff (3-4 guys) were all helpful, all spoke English well. Room was clean, neat, LCD TV, air conditioning (not the best, but did the job), and a bathroom shower and toilet. It's only 5-10 euros more per night than a private room in a hostel, but provides a lot more than just a hostel (i.e. in-room toilet and shower, fridge, TV, aircon). A previous reviewer said it felt like a hostel. It did not feel like it, but there was some refurbishment going on (April 2011) so maybe some of the older rooms were hostel like. Certainly not ours. If you are worried, just ask them for a modern room. Problem solved. If you're still unsure, look at my photos as evidence. Pictures speak a thousand works, so here's 4-thousand words for you! The room felt quite modern with the LCD TV (smallish 14"), small fridge, and clean bedding, table. This was on the 4th floor, and there were notes about construction going on. I believe a room was being refurbished close to ours as we did hear some noise during the day. Definitely no noise at night (4th floor, not overlooking any pedestrian area). Room service did a good job and visited daily during the 5 day stay. Internet was free, and wifi was available all throughout the hotel. Most importantly, it was fast. Didn't partake in the breakfast as wanted to try the local food in and around Barcelona. Location is very central, about 2-3 streets away from Las Ramblas. A 2 minute walk at most. Several convenience stores are nearby. The beach is about a 10-15 minute walk. The hotel entrance does have a bit to be desired as it is down a side street and so for the unfamiliar can come across as a bit dodgy. It's not though. If you're visiting it for the first time, take a chance to view Google Street Maps to give you an idea of how to walk to it from Drassanes Metro/Las Ramblas. Sleep was fine, no noises interrupting at night. Room view wasn't much, but then I'm not interested in a hotel view I'm interested in exploring cities. What I see outside the room window doesn't bother me much. At checkout we were asked if we needed a cab, which we did and the reception person phoned up a taxi and within 10 minutes we were on our way. Taxi to airport cost €32 (someone else had €37, I'd put this down to traffic plus airports often have surcharges). In terms of my ratings, I put the location at only 4 star due to the back-alley feeling issue (which in reality is a non-issue, but some people may see it differently). Everything else gets 5 stars for this price range.

Reviews.Title: “A hostel, not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maureenann18
Reviews.Content: Max on reception never made eye contact when we entered, asking for our passports and payment on arrival. First impressions stick! He lightened up over the week and became quite the charmer. A bit late! Out of the 3 men on reception I encountered, Phillipe was a gentleman. He was lovely. The "hostel" is very well situated within minutes of the Rambla, shopping, restaurants, beach, taxis and metro. The room was not clean when we booked in. Looked like it hadn't been cleaned in 6 months. Dust on the skirting was thick, and the washbasin was dirty. I complained after 4 days and the bedding was changed; washbasin was cleaned. The room was still dirty as the corners were not cleaned and dirt was sticking to the chair legs. Balls of fluffy dirt were everywhere. Two good points were an electronic safe and a larder fridge. Don't expect to sleep well as the noise is awful from the people on the same floor. Loud voices constantly and slamming of doors every few minutes. No-one takes any heed of the noise restriction from 11.00pm. The street below is also noisy if you happen to have a room with a balcony facing out from the front. Arguments, voices and skate boarders are the norm even at 2 or 3am. In the morning if you are lucky to have had a few hours sleep, you are wakened by the building site right across the street, at 7.30am. Finally, we ordered a taxi for the El Prat airport at reception the night before we left, and were quoted 30 euros from Max. The taxi meter showed €20.80 when we got there, then the driver fiddled with the meter and quoted €37.10, which he said was tax. Bye, bye Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Back ache was worth the location”
Reviews.Author: OOFA2
Reviews.Content: Location was awesome! Close to everything. Easy to get to from airport. My only complaint is the beds and pillow are hard as a rock. I had to take to pain pills every night because my back and neck would hurt so bad. I would stay again, however I will be packing my own pillow and possible a travel blow up mattress. Don't expect much from hotel staff for ideas. Come prepared. If you are a budget traveler than this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: hey_ive_been_there
Reviews.Content: Location is great, Free Wi-fi, Hot shower. If you are going to Barcelona, stay somewhere in the Gothic Qtr. This hotel is close to the water and right in the heart of the Gothic Qtr. It is just a short walk to shopping, shows, historic sights, bus tours, bike tours, movies, beaches, food and more... My only complaint was the bed and pillow. Tip: bring your ear plugs and a micro-bead pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, basic”
Reviews.Author: Amy_kiwi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, a few mins walk from the square where the RunnerBean walking tours meet (also very good) and Los Caracoles a great restaurant. Also close to Las Ramblas, the port/beach, close to a metro, the Gothic Quarter. Not far from the airport buses etc (2 metro stops, or prob 10-15min walk). Rooms were fine. No air con so slept with the door open. We were over the street and the sound echoed. That was the main down side. We slept through it pretty well though. Of the 3 guys who took turns on reception, one was fantastic, one was OK, and the other was grumpy and rude! So they mixed it up a bit. But you don't have to deal with them too much. There is a (free) luggage room too and I beleive you can check in quite early (but the cleaner literally came in on the dot of check out!). They have WiFi, but it's a bit sporadic. There is also a computer, it was 50c / 15min. Expect basic, but I would stay again, price and location are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrDarcy_10
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for a short stay in Barcelona. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Luggage was stored for us when we arrived too early for check in. The hotel room was quiet, well equipped and perfectly located, close to the bustling Ramblas and a short walk to the Port/beach area.

Reviews.Title: “very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: annieqYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Have been here twice and think this a very good budget hotel, it has friendly staff and you can get a buffet breakfast for 5 euros. It is close to bars, restaurants, shops, the beach and transport . It can get a bit noisy outside on an evening but is usually quite through the night. I would definately recommend it and will be going again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: lewispavey
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel, this ticked all the boxes providing excellent value for money. Situated just of the bottom end of the Rambla it is perfectly located in the Gothic part of the city, full of character and atmosphere, close to restaurants and the water front (which is stunning). Although we loved it, it is set in the less glamorous area. Our room (209) was spotlessly clean, good bathroom with fab shower, comfortable beds, fridge and free safe. Continental breakfast cost 5 eu which was adequate if a bit limited. Staff were helpful and offered us the use of a shower room on our last day after checking out at 12.00 midday. There was a bit of noise in the night but nothing to worry about and not in the league that some reviewers have mentioned. If you staying here, don’t bother with airport tranfers (we were quoted 140 Euros return). For 20 Euros we caught the airport bus which stops at the Placa Catalunya at the top of the Rambla and walked to the hotel - 20 minute stroll and thoroughly entertaining with all the street artists and stalls to take in. Top tip - if you have time buy a 2 day open top bus ticket which will take you all over Barcelona with guided tours. Cost 23 eu for 2 days but worth it. Overall we would recommend El Canton for a no frills Hotel and will stay again next time we go

Reviews.Title: “don't go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinusj
Reviews.Content: The man that worked here at night came into our room with a baseball bat, and was very angry because of noise. the noise didn't even come from our room, but he blamed us... the rooms are small but it's nice enough to sleep in. the bathroom is too small. when you've got to go to the toilet, your knees wil touch the wall in front of you. I didn't like this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and great location”
Reviews.Author: malcolmscott Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a basic but clean hotel. The rooms are simply furnished and equiped to a decent standard. Its not luxury - its simple. If you just want a base from which to explore Barcelona and you're not bothered about having expensive extras you should stay here. The street on which the hotal is located is a bit drab and some people could see it as scary but its just a typical Barcelona back street. The staff in the hotel are not the servile, crawlers you get in some of the bigger hotels - they are polite and reserved but friendly enough. The optional breakfast is pretty poor and walking a few metres to a local bar/taverna would enable you to get freshly brewed coffee and superb pastries for less money that the hotel charges for its vending machine fayre. All in all if you're looking for a cheap base in a great location then this hotel is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Europe_Travel_Squad
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canton is perfectly located. If you walk out the front door and turn left, you are on in the Borne area, which hosts small bars, cafes and restaurants within the narrow winding streets. Turn right and the beach, port promenade and the start of Las Ramblas is a 30 second walk. The nearest metro station is about 5 minutes walk which serves most of Barcelonas hot spots without having to change line. The rooms are basic, but excellent value for money for this location. Nearly all rooms have a TV, Air conditioning and a shower - but its best to check before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this, it smelled terrible.”
Reviews.Author: BCWendy
Reviews.Content: The positive things are that the location is fairly good - short taxi ride to the pier (we went on a cruise), and just 2 short blocks from La Rambla, and the front desk manager is helpful and friendly. Was amusing that it is in what we would consider to be a narrow back lane. Even the taxi driver couldn't find it. There were many negative things though: - the bathroom smelled just horrible (bad sewer smell). So much that I had to hold my breath while using it and keep the door closed when we were in the room. - the rooms are tiny - like a cruise ship stateroom - still feels and looks like a hostel, not a hotel. We are from Canada and just thought this was a bad place to stay. Luckily we were there only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location to start your visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: marina5719
Reviews.Content: This hotel I absolutely recommend. Good price, clean bathroom, good beds. Breakfast is simple, but enough. Staff is friendly and offers a good service. The location is great. Close to the Ramblas, close to the stop of the 'hop on hop off ' bus. Plaza Real is a nice area with good restaurants, also in walking distance. We had a fantastic stay in Barcelona! Ineke, Rinie, Iris, Holland

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Sabstian
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 nights of romantic vacation. We had a really good experience: very good location (on the entrance to the Gothic quarter, 2 minutes from La Rambles/ the metro); friendly staff; very clean room with a little balcony; and a generally good feeling of coming home. As for cons, our room was quite small, the bed was a little too small (only about 120 cm!) and the AC wasn't that strong, but it was really OK for the price. For 65 EU per night it is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “simple, but nice budget hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: desertblues
Reviews.Content: If you are searching for basic but clean and well-located accommodation in Barcelona I would highly recommend Hotel Canton. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We arrived around midnight due to a delayed flight and the guy who checked us in was nice and very chatty despite such a late check-in. The hotel is close to Las Ramblas, the metro and the beach making it ideal for sightseeing and sunbathing!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: ALH57
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for one night and was really pleased with the standard and cleanliness of rooms for the money we paid - 70 Euros per night for a twin room. The hotel is ideally placed for Las Ramblas, the harbour and the underground station (Drassane). We were obviously lucky because the hotel was very quiet so no problems with noisey neighbours. I'd certainly recommend this hotel for those on a budget or if you just need a hotel for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Good Location, Just Not Soundproof”
Reviews.Author: IndianaFelicity
Reviews.Content: We had read some positive reviews about this place and booked 2 nights on Orbitz.com before our trip. The place is hard to find, and we stumbled upon it sort of randomly. The service was always polite and adequate, and we had no problems with check-in or check-out. The room was good-sized, with a small couch and double bed, and the bathroom was big compared to what we were expecting. Location is great - close to La Rambla if that's what you're going for, but also a couple blocks off of it and close to the more laid-back restaurants and bars, too. They also had free WiFi, and they let us borrow an adaptor for our laptop. I'd say that I like the room size (big) best and liked the sound-proofing of the room least - we didn't have a problem with street noise, but you can hear absolutely everything in the hallway, so if neighbors come home late you will know it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Canton
HotelInfo.Address: Nou de Sant Francesc 40, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
